titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I told Maish that he might hold office until Christmas: and Ernest Alexander, the butler, that I would take him into my service.

After lunch we left the Castle, and travelled from Barnard Castle, via Teebay, Preston, & Crewe to Rode Hall, where we passed the night under the ever–hospitable roof of our friends the Baker–Wilbrahams.
